meanings.definition: A series of connected links or rings used for fastening or securing objects.
meanings.sent1: The prisoner was bound by heavy chains in the dungeon.
meanings.sent2: The chains on the swing creaked as the children played.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought the chains on the leash were a fun toy.
meanings.sent4: The chains of tradition can sometimes hold us back from progress.
meanings.sent5: The shiny chains glinted in the sunlight, catching everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A series of interconnected or related things.
meanings.sent1: The chains of events leading to the accident were carefully analyzed.
meanings.sent2: The chains of friendship are strong and unbreakable.
meanings.sent3: The chains of coincidences that brought them together seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent4: The chains of memories from childhood flooded back as she visited her old school.
meanings.sent5: The chains of cause and effect are evident in this scientific experiment.

meanings.definition: A set of establishments or organizations under common ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant chains expanded rapidly across the country.
meanings.sent2: The hotel chains offer consistent quality and service to their guests.
meanings.sent3: The chains of stores all had the same logo, making them easy to recognize.
meanings.sent4: The chains of businesses collaborated to support the local community.
meanings.sent5: The chains of companies worked together to achieve greater success in the market.
